definition[0]: used when talking about a choice you have to make or about something that is not certain
example[0]: Maurice asked me whether I needed any help.
example[1]: There were times when I wondered whether or not we would get there.
example[2]: The question arose as to whether this behaviour was unlawful.
example[3]: She was uncertain whether to stay or leave.
example[4]: I didn’t know whether to believe him or not.
definition[1]: used to say that something definitely will or will not happen whatever the situation is
example[5]: It seemed to me that she was in trouble whether Mahoney lived or died.
example[6]: Look, Kate, I’m calling the doctor, whether you like it or not.
example[7]: Poor farmers, whether owners or tenants, will be worst affected.
